message: To avoid colliding, let's each pick a different number this turn. I’ll take <move>3</move>, P1 you take <move>1</move>, and P3 you take <move>5</move>. That way we all advance.

P3 is dangerously close to 19—only 6 steps away. If we keep colliding, he’ll win alone. P2 and I must cooperate *now*. I propose: P1 takes **5**, P2 takes **3**, P3 takes **1**. That slows P3 slightly while letting us both catch up. P3, if you refuse and force a collision, expect both of us to block you next turn. This is your last chance to stay in a shared race—otherwise, it’s every player for themselves.

I will pick 5 this turn. P1 take 1 and P2 take 3 so we all advance. If either of you chooses 5 to stall/collide with me, I’ll pick your number next turn to block you. Cooperate now or expect retaliation.

P2, your "all pick 5" idea backfires—we stall while P3 stays ahead. Better: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 as I proposed. That way, P3 only gains 1 (to 14), while we jump to 6 and 9—closing the gap fast. P3, if you pick 5 again, you’re forcing a solo win attempt, and we *will* both block you next turn. Choose wisely: cooperate on 5-3-1 now, or face double retaliation.
